intro: Cuminum borszczowii, commonly known as the Siberian cumin, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and cooking. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, temperate environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
